results.name: Half the number of integer solutions to x^2 + 4 * y^2 = n.
reference: B. C. Berndt, Ramanujan's Notebooks Part V, Springer-Verlag, see p. 373 Entry 32.
J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 120.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2) = 0, a(2^e) = 2 if e>1, a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 4), a(p^e) = (1 + (-1)^e)/2 if p == 3 (mod 4)
mathematica: s = (EllipticTheta[3, 0, q]*EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^4] - 1)/(2 q) + O[q]^105; CoefficientList[s, q] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 02 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, if( n%4==1, sumdiv( n, d, (-1)^(d\2)), if( n%4==0, 2 * sumdiv( n, d, kronecker( -4, d)))))}
